section.title: Past simple of be: positive form
section.sectiontitle: We use was/were to talk about a finished state or action in the past. In the singular, we use I was, you were and he/she/it was. There is no short form.
section.text1a: I was very happy, but you were sad.
section.text2a: He was an actor and his wife was a housewife.
section.sectiontitle2: In the plural, we use we/you/they were. There is no short form.

section.title: Past simple of be: negative form
section.sectiontitle:
In the singular, we use I was not, you were not and he/she/it was not. We usually
use the short forms: I wasn't, you weren't and he/she/it wasn't.
section.sectiontitle2: In the plural, we use we/you/they weren't.
